decks.notes: This deck revolves around quickly deploying artifacts onto the battlefield to fuel various synergies and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, it aims to generate early advantage and put pressure on the opponent while maintaining card advantage with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast. The deck aims to be fast and efficient, utilizing the explosive potential of cards like Engineered Explosives and Arcbound Ravager to quickly win the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Solitude, while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Quantum Riddler. The deck utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate to abuse enter-the-battlefield abilities, and has cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to control the tempo of the game. The combination of disruption, aggression, and card advantage makes it difficult for opponents to stabilize and take control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. It utilizes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with support spells like Mana Tithe and Thraben Charm. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment provide additional synergy and ways to keep up the pressure. The deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain pressure through efficient threats and disruptive spells, ultimately aiming to win the game through a combination of sustained aggression and strategic resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command. By utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Nethergoyf, the deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and powerful creatures, this Mono Black Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly amass artifacts on the battlefield and use them in combination with aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal, Mishra's Bauble, and Springleaf Drum to generate mana and ramp up quickly, the deck can deploy threats such as Arcbound Ravager and Ornithopter at a rapid pace. The inclusion of cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt also allow for disruption of the opponent's game plan, while Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key artifacts.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies centered around disrupting opponents' plans while deploying threats that can quickly close out the game. By utilizing cards that provide value and tempo advantage, as well as powerful creatures with disruptive abilities, the deck aims to control the board state and push through damage efficiently. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan and provide consistent access to the necessary colors of mana for casting spells. The deck's synergy and cohesive strategy make it a formidable force in one-on-one Modern matchups.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal while ramping up to play Scapeshift to win the game by sacrificing lands for a massive amount of damage. The deck also includes card draw and filtering to help find key pieces. Wan Shi Tong, Librarian acts as a card advantage engine while Ice-Fang Coatl and Coiling Oracle provide additional value. The deck includes a mix of lands to ensure the right colors are available when needed for spells.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures such as Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to maintain card advantage and consistency. Mishra's Bauble provides additional card filtering and information on the opponent's draws. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan while allowing for consistent casting of spells.

The key concept of this deck is to use Broodscale Bloodchief as a combo piece, along with other cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Malevolent Rumble, to build up a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Eldrazi Temple, Urza's Saga, and Ancient Stirrings help to search for and play key pieces of the combo quickly, while cards like Emrakul, the Promised End provide a powerful finisher. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for a game-winning combo.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the game and gradually gain the upper hand. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Wan Shi Tong, Librarian provides additional threats and card advantage to help secure the win. The deck also features card draw and library manipulation to ensure consistency and adaptability in different matchups.

This deck focuses on utilizing creatures as a toolbox to achieve a powerful combo. By utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith to search for specific creatures, players can create strong synergies and combos to overwhelm their opponent. Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician are key pieces in enabling these combos, while cards like Malevolent Rumble and Delighted Halfling provide additional support and disruption. The deck's mana base also supports these strategies, allowing for consistent access to the necessary colors and lands to execute the combo efficiently and effectively.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also generating card advantage and incremental value. It leans heavily on efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, as well as counterspells like Force of Negation and Counterspell to protect its own threats. The creatures in the deck provide additional disruption and value, with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Solitude offering versatile options for dealing with different threats. The mana base is tuned to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle in order to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a combination of low-cost spells and creatures, such as Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to ensure a consistent flow of threats. By utilizing these elements effectively, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and take control of the game early on.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Guide of Souls, and Galvanic Discharge to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes some control elements with Mana Tithe and Thraben Charm, as well as a finisher like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional aggression. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to apply early pressure, control the board, and finish the game quickly with powerful creatures and spells.

The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana through Ruby Medallion and rituals, while using card draw and filtering to set up a strong hand. The combo finisher involves casting Past in Flames to re-cast important spells from the graveyard and chain into a lethal Grapeshot with the help of Wrenn's Resolve and Ral, Monsoon Mage. The deck also utilizes Wish to access specific cards from outside the main deck, providing flexibility and versatility in different matchups. Overall, the deck focuses on explosive turns and efficient spell chaining to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Simic colors (Blue/Green) to generate fast mana with Birthing Ritual and ramp into powerful creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Shardless Agent. It also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation, as well as removal with Dismember. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and control, leveraging card advantage and tempo to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.
